comments.body:
I understand many people are freaking out about this, but I'm pretty sure it won't affect many people, only those who take it too far. I very heavily assume that Mojang and Microsoft will not be permanently banning players for one small, minor offense(such as saying a single or a few bad words). If players would continuously be rude to others on a high level and have several warnings by admins, then they may be banned, but not on a scale that the average child or adult would achieve. Also, the new system of universal banning will definitely not delete single player worlds, only restrict online activity.

Disclaimer: I do not work on Minecraft, but based upon strong reasoning, I believe they are not trying to make Minecraft an unplayable or unenjoyable game, just pushing out the people that try to do just that.

Swearing doesn't get you banned, but apparently this is not clear among the Minecraft community.

You can find a list of forbidden things by pressing the left button of your mouse on this line of green text.
I agree, I think this ban system is too strict. Mojang should let servers Moderate themselves. Mojang also should add a strike system, temp bans and at least a way to appeal a ban.

I'm glad to see somebody understands how tightly strict it is. Anarchy servers have people spamming slurs, and stuff so this feature would ruin a whole portion of the servers if it were really this strict.

Mojang does not delete your worlds or touch anything on your device when you are banned, it only bans you from online play. Also, mojang wouldn't ban you for saying a bad word once in a while as it already censors it in chat.

Ya, you are not alone. This whole update is very frustrating to the whole community. Minecraft might just be dying. It doesnt help that microsoft cant even complete an update without splitting it into 3 or 4 different mini updates.
Great idea!
I would love this

Now that joining a friend's session into a realm no longer allows operators to act as an admin, this is even more necessary. no clue why they felt the need to fix this. now, the only option to allow anyone other than the owner to switch from peaceful to easy+ is to enable cheats... which we're not trying to do.

I'd also like to see a more limited version of operator available, where players can be set to creative mode, but cannot access commands and command blocks, so they cannot change the gamerules that are set in place.
That or even allow operators to change the difficulty! Why I have to ask the admin to get on to make sure it’s not on peaceful cause they wanted to afk!?

This exactly, I've been saying the same thing for years. The current realm management system is disappointing because the only person able to manage the realm is the owner. As a realm owner myself, I want to be able to give admin privileges to other trusted members so they can manage it in my absence.
If you're talking about the Bedrock edition, this would be an AMAZING feature to add. Mod caps are so frustrating.
My bedrock server feels dead when there's a couple people on it because of the mob cap. Also things like slime farms barely work. Would like to raise the cap higher than 200.

This feature, We server onwers should be able to decide what mob cap ours server can run. i'm  working in a workaround limiting per mob cap to reduce sheeps/chicken/cow/pig farms to reduce  effect  on the global cap.

Adding comment about the Bedrock version. The mob cap got easily hit by 1 person on my server. Minecraft players are extreme, why set it as low as 200. I understand it's to avoid performance issues and people spamming the issue tracker but I think that if we are allowed to chose or have like 500-1k mobs people will understand that it's their fault. It's still being tested after all it's not a release...
Not only the global mob caps, the local mob caps as well because by default they are very low, only 8 hostile mobs at a time.

The lack of ability to tweak this Mob Cap setting is a very limiting feature in 1.20.80.
I host a two player server and we’ve easily hit the mob cap. Exploring the world when nothing spawns is an extremely broken experience and has been this way for years.
You can turn cheats off
If playing in Bedrock you can simply make them member, if in Java Edition I believe there is a /op command or something like that.

Well, players cannot cheat unless the "allow cheats" option is set to true, or if they are moderators of the realm.

Also, PureAwsome334, the command he would need to run would be: /deop hisfriendsgamertag
See the Java Minecraft server 2b2t for anarchy.

Again, I feel like moderating private realms, I wanted to make an anarchy realm, now that is ruined by your moderation, also, I feel like if you will do this, appealing NEEDS TO BE A THING, also, some realm owners may, e.g allow duping of some items, I feel like when moderation is enforced, the OWNER must report it, this way, if the owner, e.g allows duping, then the owner doesn't report it to mods, If they don't like it, then they report it, also, owners can block people from the realm to begin with, this moderation is POINTLESS

Seriously, It should be something that needs to be reported, not monitored without consent, I dint ask mojang to monitor me, but now i have to deal with it, Oml, if the owner doesn't report it, then they are fine with it, and it should not be punished, whats next, am I going to be banned for using an X ray texture pack(not a hack client, a texture pack, that is enabled though texture pack menu)even tho my buddy allows me to use it if we share the diamonds.
They’re completely different products and services, why would they add it to Game Pass Ultimate? It’s not even a big enough selling point for most people
I want this to! It would be a great selling point for game pass, simular to EA Play coming! But first Minecraft Windows 10 should come to Game Pass PC (It's already in Game Pass Console) and xCloud!
I would love this idea.
I think this is the best idea ever it is fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I agree, this would also be useful for maintaining compatibility with custom maps.

I strongly agree with this user! I think, though minecraft realm is fast and I can even connect and play with my friends in China when I am in Canada, it is still impossible for me to play previous versions of minecraft in realm. So, I hope the minecraft team can update realm!
Maybe there should even be a way to host a Realm on versions where Realms didn't even exist. That way, people can easily play Alpha or something with their friends.

I really think it's not fair that we can reverse worlds & the version of minecraft all together, but not realms.

My brother and I got really nostalgic and wanted to play 1.8 together on a realm. It's too bad that doesn't seem possible but I think it's a really good idea

I honestly think they should also add 2 permission levels one called owner and the other one called co owner so when owner’s offline busy or just doesn’t want to play any co owners can ban or kick out anyone break that specific realm’s rules but operators could only kick and they can keep the operator level for when the owner and any co owners are offline

First, I know that plugins can't be added to Realms, but it's the idea that I want to convey.

I really wish we had permission management "like" the LuckPerms plugin for java servers. LuckPerms is a permissions plugin for Minecraft servers found on GitHub. It allows server admins to control what features players can use by creating groups and assigning permissions.  I mention it because I've used it on my own modded server I had before moving to Bedrock Realms and it was the most important plugin in my opinion.

I could restrict actions, like placing lava, for a user group created for my son's friends that couldn't follow the rules. lol

I could also selectively grant some of the admin commands to a moderator group without having to give them all admin commands.

I could also selectively grant some of the admin commands to a trusted-users group without having to give them all admin commands.  

LuckPerms permission node system is amazing so I'd love to see something better than what we currently have in Realms, which as you know, is only Visitor, Owner, or Member and we can't even customize those!   What IF I wanted my Visitors to be able to interact with doors, buttons, switches, but not build or break things?  What IF I also wanted Visitors to not have to eat food or take damage?  This can all be configured with a better permissions management system. 

Thank you for reading.

I used to host my city world on PS3 Edition/PS Vita Edition in 2014, then PS4 Edition from 2015-19, then Bedrock Edition on my PS4 before Realms came along and made moving to PC possible via the download world button. I don't host on my PC because it's honestly easier to use a Realm so I can jump between PS4/PS5 and PC seamlessly- I can even use PS4 Remote Play on the PS Vita to get some extra life out of it. I wish there was at least a command for issuing permissions individually- It really does seem like a downgrade (considering [Name of Console] Edition had individual permissions) and it should be the next big thing for Realms because they honestly work very well regardless of where I want to play- I just wish I could make it so people can fly around and explore places with doors and stuff without worrying that they'll destroy 10 years of building progress while doing so.
I second this. Along with being able to install customer packs.

1. Microsoft likes money

2. People uninstall Minecraft if they can't transfer worlds

3. Microsoft loses money

They should also make it so that your latest save in, for example, Xbox one edition, will also be the last save for, another example, pocket edition. And it's so simple. Use a similar code roblox uses.

Yes, the file called "bedrock_server_how_to.html” tell me how to use "save hold,save query" to make a backup of server. But It doesn't teach me how to use the backup. So I get the backup but I don't know how to rewind.

I figured out a manual way to do it.
In your server folder, there will be a folder labeled "worlds." Inside that folder will be a folder for each "Level" your server started. In my case, I went into the server textfile and told it to name my levels "WK Bedrock" and thus I have a "WK Bedrock" folder in my Worlds folder.

To create a backup, simply copy that folder to a different location. I added a "Backups" folder to the server's main folder and just pasted it there, and renamed it with a time/date stamp. In order to bring the back up, well, back, simply copy/paste/move the world you want into the "worlds" folder and make sure either the server text file has the EXACT SAME NAME under "level-name" as the folder or you change the folder to have the same name in the text file.

It's clunky, and completely manual, but it works so far.

I'm assuming the featured servers are paid to be put on the front page there. Maybe separate custom servers from the integrated Bedrock servers as they still seem vital for console players. Or add custom servers to the "Worlds" tab. Console server navigation doesn't seem the best from reading other comments, a proper server browser would probably be a better overall solution given all above problems.

Strongly disagree.

You usually don't have the necessary performance on mobile devices to host a server. Yeah, you can join and play, but start walking around and try interacting with the environment. You'll notice huge delays. I don't see what the point of having mobile dedicated servers would even be. Everyone walking on this planet has easy access to acquiring a computer. So just go out and buy one. Or you could like try using Pocketmine, although I don't think they support the recent versions anymore.

This would solve so many problems, in example my friend is owner of the server, but another friend and myself have paid 3 out of every 4 months.. I feel like it needs multiple owners or multiple paying sources.
Yes... just yes.
This should be like a donation system where people can donate to pay for it and it can go over and pre pay a few charges and also do add five player realms

I agree this should be looked into. I hosted a realm for over two years and closed it for the lack of protections. As the host of a realm I feel it is my obligation to give players the best environmet for comfortable gameplay. Being able to donate to your favorite realm would ensure its longevity. This is something I attempted to do via a paypal money pool and a discord community to no avail. If it was a direct payment to the realm itself without involving a third party that could potentially be misuesd I think most people would feel more confident in donating. It would also be very cool to customize names in chat with colors so you can display you are a donator. No in game items or such that violate the EULA, just a visual thing to show everyone your a supporter of the realm you are currently in. As far as player cap otions, I feel like it should be more along these lines, 5 replacing the 2 player option), 10 as it is now, 20 for about twice the amount as the 10 player option and then beyond that have it be more of an incremental scale going up by 2 slots for a fixed amount of money. this would be amazing for those larger realms who get a ton of traffic.
Yes, this would be a great donation system to only the realm subscription and not used for profit.
